Check browser console for errors\n2. Verify data is being passed to component\n3. Simplify chart to basic SVG circles\n4. If still broken, use HTML/CSS grid as fallback\n\n**Recovery Time:** 10-15 min\n\n---\n\n### Scenario B: \"Quadrants are in wrong positions\"\n\n**Symptoms:** PRJ-001 shows in wrong quadrant\n**Time to Detect:** Phase 3 (70-80 min)\n**Immediate Action:**\n1. labeled (e.g., \"Quick Wins\", \"Big Bets\").  \n* **Interactivity:**  \n  * **Filtering:** Sidebar controls to toggle Departments or Phases.  \n  * **Tooltips:** Hovering a node shows Title \\+ ROI.  \n  * **Zoom:** Brush-to-zoom functionality for crowded clusters.\n\n### **4.4 Page: Roadmap Gantt (/roadmap)**\n\n* **Objective:** Timeline visualization and sequencing.  \n* **Component:** Horizontal scrolling timeline.  \n* **Features:**  \n  * **Grouping:** Dropdown to group rows by Department or Status.  \n  * **Current Time:** Vertical red line indicating \"Today\".  \n  * **Status Colors:** Bars colored by status (Active=Green, Delayed=Red).  \n  * **Milestones:** Diamond icons overlaid on bars representing key deliverables.\n\n### **4.5 Page: Project Library (/projects)**\n\n* **Objective:** Searchable database of all initiatives.  \n* **Layout:** Card Grid or Data Table (User toggleable).  \n* **Filters:**  \n  * Multi-select for Owner, Status, Department.  \n  * Range slider for Cost/ROI.  \n* **Card Anatomy:** Title, ID Badge, Status Pill, Owner Avatar, Sparkline (progress).\n\n### **4.6 Page: Project Detail (/projects/\\[slug\\])**\n\n* **Objective:** The \"Single Source of Truth\" for a specific initiative.  \n* **Layout:** Two-column (Main Content \\+ Metadata Sidebar).  \n* **Main Content:**  \n  * **Header:** Title, Description, Status Badge.  \n  * **Tabs:**  \n    * *Overview:* The rendered Markdown content.  \n    * *Plan:* Checklist of deliverables and milestones.  \n    * *Updates:* Filtered list of Status Updates referencing this project ID.  \n* **Sidebar:**  \n  * **\"The Numbers\":** Hard metrics (Cost, ROI, Dates).  \n  * **\"Team\":** List of stakeholders.  \n  * **\"Dependencies\":** Links to blocking/blocked projects.  \n*         "contents": "│                     │  │                     │\n│ +12% from last month│  │                     │\n└─────────────────────┘  └─────────────────────┘\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**Styling:**\n- Card: White background, subtle shadow, rounded corners (8px)\n- Metric: 32px bold\n- Subtitle: 14px gray\n- Grid: 2 columns on desktop, 1 on mobile\n\n---\n\n## 3. Responsive Behavior\n\n| Breakpoint          | Layout       | Matrix Width | Sidebar                |\n| ------------------- | ------------ | ------------ | ---------------------- |\n| Mobile (&lt;768px)     | Stacked      | Full width   | Hidden, hamburger menu |\n| Tablet (768-1024px) | Stacked      | 100%         | Collapsible            |\n| Desktop (&gt;1024px)   | Side-by-side | 70%          | Fixed 240px            |\n\n**Matrix Responsiveness:**\n- Use &#96;&lt;ResponsiveContainer&gt;&#96; from Recharts\n- Min-height: 400px on mobile\n- Point size: 10px on mobile, 12px on desktop\n\n---\n\n## 4. Accessibility (WCAG AA Target)\n\n- [ ] All interactive elements keyboard accessible\n- [ ] Focus indicators visible (2px outline)\n- [ ] Color contrast ratio ≥ 4.5:1 for text\n- [ ] Quadrant labels have &#96;aria-label&#96;\n- [ ] Tooltip has &#96;role=\"tooltip\"&#96; and &#96;aria-describedby&#96;\n- [ ] Filter checkboxes have proper labels\n\n---\n\n## 5. Animation &amp; Polish\n\n**Subtle animations (no overkill):**\n- Point hover: &#96;transform: scale(1.2)&#96; with 150ms ease\n- Filter toggle: 200ms fade\n- Page load: Staggered fade-in for cards (50ms delay each)\n- No parallax, no complex motion\n\n**Typography:**\n- Headings: Inter (from config), 600 weight\n- Body: Roboto (from config), 400 weight\n- Base size: 16px\n- Line height: 1.5\n\n---\n\n## 6. Outputs &#96;public/master_data.json&#96;\n3. Change &#96;loadProjects.ts&#96; to fetch JSON in production\n4. [Search code, repositories, users, issues, pull requests...](https://github.com/recharts/recharts/issues/4644)<br/><br/># Recharts Custom Tooltip Content Component<br/><br/>To create a custom tooltip in Recharts, use the `content` prop on the `Tooltip` component and pass a custom React component.[4]<br/><br/>## Basic Implementation<br/><br/>Define a custom tooltip component that receives `active`, `payload`, and `label` props:[4]<br/><br/>```jsx<br/>const CustomTooltip = (\{ active, payload, label \}) => \{<br/>  if (active && payload && payload.length) \{<br/>    return (<br/>      <div className="custom-tooltip"><br/>        \{`$\{label\}: $\{payload[0].value\}`\}<br/>      </div><br/>    );<br/>  \}<br/>  return null;<br/>\};<br/>```<br/><br/>Then integrate it into your chart:[4]<br/><br/>```jsx<br/><LineChart data=\{data\}><br/>  <CartesianGrid /><br/>  <XAxis /><br/>  <YAxis /><br/>  <Tooltip content=\{<CustomTooltip />\} /><br/>  <Line type="monotone" dataKey="uv" /><br/></LineChart><br/>```<br/><br/>## Customization Options<br/><br/>The `DefaultTooltipContent` component (used by default) accepts several props for styling and formatting:[2]<br/>- `contentStyle` - customize wrapper styles<br/>- `itemStyle` - customize individual item styles<br/>- `labelFormatter` - format the label<br/>- `formatter` - format values<br/>- `separator` - customize the separator between label and value<br/>- `wrapperClassName` and `labelClassName` - for CSS classes<br/><br/>You can also completely replace the default content with your own independent component.[2][3] |

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Configuring scatter chart**

I'm implementing the custom tooltip component for the scatter chart with title, quadrant, impact, effort, ROI, and department. </details></think>

---


Here are practical ways to implement the tooltip component in your project.

---

## 1. Recharts Custom `content` (Best fit for your Strategy Matrix)

Your chart uses **Recharts** and `MatrixDataPoint`. Use Recharts’ custom `content` prop:

```tsx
// MatrixTooltip.tsx - Recharts custom content component
interface MatrixTooltipProps {
  active?: boolean;
  payload?: Array<{ payload: MatrixDataPoint }>;
  label?: string;
}

export function MatrixTooltip({ active, payload }: MatrixTooltipProps) {
  if (!active || !payload?.length) return null;

  const point = payload[0].payload; // MatrixDataPoint
  const roi = new Intl.NumberFormat("en-US", {
    style: "currency",
    currency: point.financials.currency,
    maximumFractionDigits: 0,
  }).format(point.financials.projected_roi);

  return (
    <div
      role="tooltip"
      className="rounded border border-gray-200 bg-white px-3 py-2 shadow-lg max-w-[250px] text-sm"
    >
      <div className="font-semibold">{point.title}</div>
      <hr className="my-1 border-gray-200" />
      <div>Quadrant: {point.quadrant}</div>
      <div>Impact: {point.y}</div>
      <div>Effort: {point.x}</div>
      <div>ROI: {roi}</div>
      <div>Department: {point.department}</div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

Usage in `StrategyMatrix.tsx`:

```tsx
<ScatterChart>
  <CartesianGrid strokeDasharray="3 3" />
  <XAxis dataKey="x" name="Effort (Complexity)" />
  <YAxis dataKey="y" name="Impact (Strategic Value)" />
  <Tooltip content={<MatrixTooltip />} cursor={false} />
  <Scatter data={data} />
</ScatterChart>
```

Notes:

- `payload[0].payload` is your `MatrixDataPoint` for the hovered point.
- Add `role="tooltip"` for accessibility (your UI delivery plan already mentions this).
- Use Tailwind for styling instead of inline styles (e.g. white background, shadow, border, max-width, padding).

---

## 2. Alternative Approaches (for non-chart tooltips)

These are better for standalone UI tooltips (buttons, icons, links):

| Approach | When to use | Pros | Cons |
|----------|-------------|------|------|
| **Recharts `content`** | Chart scatter points | Native, no extra deps | Only for Recharts tooltips |
| **Radix UI `@radix-ui/react-tooltip`** | Any trigger element | Accessible, controlled | Extra dependency |
| **Floating UI / Popper.js** | Custom, flexible tooltips | Very flexible | More setup |
| **CSS `title` / `data-tooltip`** | Simple, static text | Zero JS | No rich content, limited styling |
| **Headless UI** | Already using it | Consistent with rest of UI | Extra dependency |

For chart points, stick with Recharts.

---

## 3. Best Practices (from your docs)

1. **Accessibility**

   - Add `role="tooltip"`.
   - Optional: link via `aria-describedby` if the trigger is keyboard-focusable.

2. **Styling (from your UI delivery plan)**

   - Background: white with shadow  
   - Border: `1px solid #E5E7EB`  
   - Padding: 12px  
   - Font: 14px  
   - Max-width: 250px  

   Tailwind equivalents: `bg-white shadow`, `border border-gray-200`, `p-3`, `text-sm`, `max-w-[250px]`.

3. **Scatter payload**

   Recharts Scatter passes `{ payload: MatrixDataPoint }` per point. Use `payload[0].payload` to access the full `MatrixDataPoint`.

4. **Formatting**

   Use `Intl.NumberFormat` for ROI (and other numbers) so it matches the project’s `currency` field.

5. **Cursor**

   `cursor={false}` on `Tooltip` disables the default crosshair cursor, which can look cleaner with your design.

---

## Summary

For your Strategy Matrix, implement `MatrixTooltip.tsx` as a Recharts custom tooltip via the `content` prop:

- Use `payload[0].payload` for `MatrixDataPoint`.
- Style with Tailwind (white bg, shadow, border, `max-w-[250px]`).
- Add `role="tooltip"` and format ROI with `Intl.NumberFormat`.

---
